Key Match Events: Kane Williamson scored a precise 78 against Bangladesh
Devon Conway was dropped by Mehidy Hasan Miraz at point
Daryl Mitchell played a crucial unbeaten 89 off 67 balls
Mustafizur Rahman removed Rachin Ravindra in the third over
Conway struck Shoriful Islam for two fours to break free
Williamson cracked Shoriful over point and through point and cover in the 10th over
Taskin dropped Williamson at short midwicket when the New Zealand captain was on 27
Shakib trapped Conway lbw for 45 off 59 balls
Mitchell immediately picked up the pace after Conway's wicket
Mitchell smashed six fours and four sixes in his unbeaten 89
Mushfiqur hit Henry for a six and two more fours
Shakib pulled Henry before smashing Mitchell Santner for a straight four
Mushfiqur hit Ferguson for his second six, over third man
Shakib cramped up and was out next ball, trying to slog Ferguson
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson's return to international cricket was marked with a crucial 78
Williamson's biggest contribution was to add to two sizable partnerships
New Zealand won with plenty to spare, thanks to Williamson and Mitchell's partnerships
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand reduced Bangladesh to 56 for 4 in the next over
Mahmudullah ensured Bangladesh batted out the 50 overs
Litton Das became the second Bangladeshi opener to fall in the first ball of a World Cup match
Others: Lockie Ferguson's form is important for New Zealand
Bangladesh's middle-order bungle was highlighted in the report
Trent Boult knuckled down in a changing ODI landscape
The report mentioned how Litton Das' ill-fated flick encapsulated Bangladesh's luckless night
